title: Ticket #5477: Don't run POST script if PRE script fails?
description:
Just had a phone conversation with Miron, and he is not happy with the "POST script runs if PRE script fails" semantics of DAGMan.

Note that there's a config knob for this (DAGMAN_ALWAYS_RUN_POST) so if just we want to change the default, the fix is very simple.

(The main issue with this is whether it will cause problems for any users -- I need to check about that.)

2016-Mar-30 13:51:00 by wenger:
Notes from code review w/ Zach:
  • Make it an error if both -DontAlwaysRunPost and -AlwaysRunPost are specified on the command line.
  • Make a ticket to create a new test for the POST script not getting run if the PRE script fails.
  • We debated somewhat whether this should be a shallow or deep option (agreed that deep is better in most cases, but has the disadvantage that you can't always do what you want; whereas if it's shallow you can always do what you want).
